channel.title: CVE Feed for yiisoft -- yii2-authclient
channel.description: The latest CVEs for yiisoft -- yii2-authclient

item.title: CVE-2023-50714|2023-12-22T18:30:03.118Z -- yiisoft -- yii2-authclient
item.description: yii2-authclient is an extension that adds OpenID, OAuth, OAuth2 and OpenId Connect consumers for the Yii framework 2.0. In yii2-authclient prior to version 2.2.15, the Oauth2 PKCE implementation is vulnerable in 2 ways. First, the `authCodeVerifier` should be removed after usage (similar to `authState`). Second, there is a risk for a `downgrade attack` if PKCE is being relied on for CSRF protection. Version 2.2.15 contains a patch for the issue. No known workarounds are available.

item.title: CVE-2023-50708|2023-12-22T18:25:01.925Z -- yiisoft -- yii2-authclient
item.description: yii2-authclient is an extension that adds OpenID, OAuth, OAuth2 and OpenId Connect consumers for the Yii framework 2.0. In yii2-authclient prior to version 2.2.15, the Oauth1/2 `state` and OpenID Connect `nonce` is vulnerable for a `timing attack` since it is compared via regular string comparison (instead of `Yii::$app->getSecurity()->compareString()`). Version 2.2.15 contains a patch for the issue. No known workarounds are available.
